PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Miss Eunice Hicks, 2176 Elmore Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 8, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Should jitney drivers be licensed and permitted to operate, or should they be jailed?" answer reads: "I think that there should be some arrangement which could utilize the people who have a car and want to use it for a taxicab like they do inother ciites, like Washington and Chicago. It would mean better cab service in emergencies, especially on rainy nights when you cannot get a cab for love or money."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Eunice Hicks wearing hat, eyeglasses, pattered scarf, and dark coat with three buttons, standing in front of marble wall between store windows with sign that reads "Annual January Fur Sale Save 25% to 50% Coats Capes Jackets...", shoe display, and sign that reads "Use Our Convenient Lay Away Plan"
